body_html:
I'm not very knowledgeable on installation, but I believe that a pip install uses a pre-compiled binary rather than building one specific to your machine characteristics. The warning messages you see just warn that the binary is not fully optimized for the instructions available. To build a better binary you may need to invoke bazel. Perhaps this stackoverflow thread may help you:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41293077/how-to-compile-tensorflow-with-sse4-2-and-avx-instructions

body:
I'm not very knowledgeable on installation, but I believe that a pip install uses a pre-compiled binary rather than building one specific to your machine characteristics.  The warning messages you see just warn that the binary is not fully optimized for the instructions available.  To build a better binary you may need to invoke bazel.  Perhaps this stackoverflow thread may help you:  
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/41293077/how-to-compile-tensorflow-with-sse4-2-and-avx-instructions
